title: fix: batch embeddings, remove kpi, update on restart
author: Itachi-1824

gist.headline: Polly learns portion control
gist.blurb: Our bot was trying to ingest the entire codebase in a single gulp. We've introduced batching so she can digest data without getting a token-overflow tummy ache.
gist.summary: Implemented request batching for code embeddings to prevent API token limits and fixed logic to ensure knowledge updates on restart.
gist.impact: The Polly bot is now more reliable at indexing documentation and code, resulting in fewer errors and fresher answers.
gist.visual_concept: Polly the bee as a librarian or student, dealing with too many books/scrolls. The fix is 'batching', so she is organizing a messy pile into neat, manageable stacks. The setting should be a cozy study or library.
gist.image_prompt: Cozy pixel art scene of the cute bee mascot sitting at a wooden desk, sorting a large messy pile of code scrolls into small neat stacks. Cozy 8-bit pixel art aesthetic. Soft lime green (#ecf874) and pastel gradient background. The bee wears tiny reading glasses. Warm lighting, lo-fi vibes like Stardew Valley. Nostalgic but beautiful, emotionally warm.
